reviews.review_text: My family and I had such a wonderful experience at Delara. The servers were so hospitable, friendly and kind - I love it when servers have a smile on their face despite being crazy busy (which they were), and the food was absolutely incredible. The lamb shank and beef main dishes were so flavourful and the meat incredibly soft and delicious. We got some cocktails too and I was recommended an off the menu champagne that I drank like fruit juice. I really couldn t recommend this place more. Thanks for such a wonderful night!

The Persian fusion cuisine was truly remarkable, and it captivated our taste buds. The drinks received a solid 3/5 from us, while the cozy and beautiful ambiance set the perfect mood. The food, in all its freshness and exceptional quality, exceeded our expectations and made our dinner an enjoyable experience. This restaurant is undeniably a must-visit.

The restaurant has a warm quiet ambiance. The quality of food is top notch. The restaurant space is medium size open floor with benches and tables on one side and a bar on the other. The kitchen is at the far end of the floor and visible from where you sit, so you can smell the food as it s being cooked. We tried Grilled Beef Ghalieh, Koofteh 18, and Chicken and Barberries and loved all three dishes. Grilled beef Ghalieh was like a stew with a savory sauce and a piece of tender beef short rib. The chicken was so tender. The koofteh tasted like classic nostalgic Iranian koofteh you d get at your grandma s. We were told if you d like to sit at the benches, you can leave a note when you re reserving your table if you have a preferred spot. We noted in our reservation our birthday occasion and they were nice to bring us a small cute baklava and a candle in the end. The place obviously has its own theme and is not like any other typical Persian restaurant. So if you re looking to get quantity food or kabob, this is not the right choice. But of you like to taste true Persian cuisine and experience Persian food with a contemporary style, this is absolutely the place. You can tell the owner cares about the cuisine the most. I read in the reviews that if you have a birthday cake, you can t eat it in the restaurant and it s mentioned in the website. So if you re planning a birthday and have a cake, you better review their policy or check in with them in advance. Overall we had a wonderful experience and we d like to come back when the menu changes so we can try their different dishes.

Fabulous food! Every single dish was delicious. Portion sizes were generous and the service was amazing. I am celiac and there were so many gluten free choices on the menu without any substitutions needed. Dietary restrictions: If you are celiac they will take extreme care. Each dish brought came with a reassurance that it was safe for me. Fabulous service

This is a beautiful place, and I loved the atmosphere. The food was a new take on Iranian cuisine. Their food seem to be more inspired by Iranian cusine but then taken to a fine dining level. The playing was beautiful and the food was delicious. I didnt get the chance to try their cocktails, but they did have some very interesting ones on the menu that I would probably go bavk to try.

Persian food is served in a modern and pretty style here. This place is a little bit pricier than other Persian restaurants, and that s understandable since they re using new methods and recipes to prepare food. I ve been here few times and every time I enjoyed everything. Ambience is nice and artistic. Turmeric and orange cake is always a must!

Love the interior design and decor. It has a nice Persian style but is still very modern and clean. Ive had brunch and dinner here and all the food I tried was fantastic. Service is also wonderful. Got free drinks one time when our food was taking a long time.  I dont think this place has enough hype for how good it is!

The food was so delicious and different! My favorite dish was the chicken with barberries, but I also really liked the koofteh. Everything was so good though, and I wish I lived closer so I could come back often. We didnt have a reservation and were able to sit at the bar no problem. The bartender was also really friendly and pleasant.

Update: On our recent trip to Vancouver, we just had to make time for dinner at Delara. Since our last visit, Delara has been listed by the Michelin Guide as one of its recommended restaurants. The food has gotten even better (which I didnt think possible) and the service has also improved even further. We started with the summer salad - it was bright and fresh. For drinks, we ordered doogh - just as great as our previous visits. For mains, we had the halibut with turmeric and dill sauce which comes with a side of bulgur and barberries. The cook on the halibut was perfection! We have had a lot of halibut over the last year (seems to feature on a lot of menus lately) and this iteration is without a doubt in my top 3. Just exquisite. We also had the fesenjoon with pan roasted duck breast. Fesenjoon is typically made with chicken throughout Iran but in the Caspian Sea region, it is traditionally served with duck. Every Iranian restaurant I have been to serves fesenjoon with chicken but I grew up eating it with duck, so this was a real treat! The cook on the duck was melt-in-your-mouth perfection. The sauce, sweet and tangy, was excellent. We also had tea with the turmeric and orange cake. A great dessert that really incorporates Iranian flavours without being too traditional. Delara continues to deliver! If you live in or near Vancouver, definitely check them out. If you plan on visiting the area, Id highly recommend making some time to stop at Delara! ----- A modern and fresh take on Iranian cuisine. A welcome departure from the typical kababi restaurants found in Vancouver and arguably the rest of Canada. Highly recommend the doogh - by far the best doogh Ive ever had! The Fesenjoon and Koofteh were fantastic. The chicken with barberry rice was also a hit! Delara offers a twist on traditional Iranian cuisine - if youre a purist, this might not be the place for you but Id encourage you to have an open mind and just give it a try!

The food here is so incredibly fresh I can t describe it. The salad on my lentil and rice tasted like it was just cut from a garden somewhere 5 minutes prior. The bread on my lamb sandwich was so fresh and had that soft springy dense-ness while not tasting dry. Very nice! Would love to come back for their weekend menu and dinner.

Yummy Persian food and the ambience is nice and the place is so artistic .We enjoyed our time and food here. Love the interior and calm vibes in these restaurant. Felt like we needed more items in the lunch menu ,but overall food tastes good,a must try place .
Really enjoyed this place. We came here from a recommendation and it did not disappoint. The flavours were both unique and delicious. Loved the lamb shank and chicken.

Delicious food & warm, welcoming service. Very lovely atmosphere with a great vibe. The location is nicely accessible in a beautiful area. Their dinner menu differs from daytime/lunch offers so make sure to check back to get the best of both worlds :)

Beautiful restaurant and amazing persian food with many vegetarian options. They also severe one of the best fesenjan I ever had. Best Persain restaurant in north America at least, felt really good to be there.

The food at Delara restaurant was absolutely delicious! The staff was friendly, and the atmosphere was cozy and inviting. I cant wait to come back here with my daughter (IG:makeupbysarasadrr )      Matty is wonderful server   Parmida joon thank you so much for delicious food  You are very talented Parking: I paid $6  for street parking.
The most delicious Persian Food Ive ever had. Thank you for a memorable meal and good memories. Will definitely come back many times.

Amazing Persian food-we got the Zereshk polo, Gheymeh and Fesenjoon and it was all so delicious and flavorful. The bread and spreads are a must and you can t beat the vibes in the restaurant. Loved it!

Delara stands out as one of the best Persian restaurants in Vancouver. The food is exceptionally delicious, and the staff is kind and polite, ensuring a wonderful dining experience. The interior is aesthetically pleasing, complementing the overall ambiance. Every dish on the menu is amazing, making it difficult to choose a favourite, and its evident that they use fresh ingredients in their preparations.

The food quality is amazing. This is a fusion persian cuisine, with all the authentic flavours of a home cooked meal. I have been there more than 5-6 times since they opened and have been fully satisfied with their meal and service every single time.

I ve never seen such beautiful, modern, and smart Persian restaurant abroad. The very artistic Persian interior design is giving me all good vibes from what I call the best of iran. It is too smart not having traditional kebab on menu for 2 reasons: the restaurant smells good and cuisines that are offered are more genuine rather safely popular.

Went for dineout which these days I feel like has gotten worse and Im never full. But not here. We were a group of 4 and everyone was full and satisfied. One of us have a peanut allergy and Delara was very careful to accommodate for that. All the food was amazing so I dont feel you can go wrong. I normally dont like baklava because its too sweet but this restaurant changed my mind. The sweetness level was perfect and so was the texture.

Came here during happy hour - one of the best dining experiences we ve had in a while! The olives were next level and all the meals and cocktails we ordered had such a dynamic flavour profile and are so well-balanced. The ingredients taste very fresh and I find were very worth the price point. The atmosphere is what drew us in, it s absolutely beautiful and cozy inside! You can tell the owner is very passionate about creating a unique and memorable environment. The service was great too, not too pushy but very attentive and caring. I can t wait to return and try more dishes!

Michelin-rated Persian perfection! The staff here are incredibly friendly and will make you feel right at home. We tried their special dish for the day, the saffron and buttermilk chicken sandwich, along with Fesenjoon served with Persian rice and Tahdig. Let me tell you, both dishes were absolutely mind-blowing! The chicken sandwich came with fresh bread and a delightful minty white sauce, creating the perfect combination of flavors. However, the true star of the show was definitely the Fesenjoon! It was so rich and flavorful, I couldnt get enough of it. And to top it all off, we indulged in their heavenly chocolate and halva cake paired with a scoop of Earl Grey ice cream. It was the ultimate dessert experience. This Persian restaurant is truly one-of-a-kind!

Had a lovely lunch for two here. The room is beautiful & comfortable. The chef/owner came out to say hello and even deliver a few of our dishes. Service is casual and not rushed. The food is incredible (well deserved Michelin recognition!) and we can t wait to go back soon for dinner We shared two dishes with sides of pickles and olives, enjoyed two non alcoholic beverages, and shared three desserts it was all perfect. You should go!!
A very nice spot for Persian food. The food was very delicious. The tahdig wasnt quite as crunchy as traditional tahdig. The koofteh was seasoned very well. And the bread was awesome!

The service was fabulous. The restaurant was packed on Friday night but our server was top notch. She really went above and beyond. Just one example: At the end of dinner I asked for fresh mint tea and even though its not on the menu, she said  why not, we have mint in the kitchen, i can definitely do it . We had Georgian wine (Pheasants tears) and it was absolutely fantastic. Highly recommended. We also really loved duck (main) and the dips (appetizer).

reviews.reviewer_name: Wang Cho Peter Chan (live like a cellist)
reviews.review_text: Delara Restaurant offers an impeccable journey through Persian gastronomy. Their menu is as much a testament to the rich heritage of Iranian cuisine as it is a testament to contemporary culinary innovation. Starting with the Koofteh, an opulent Persian starter, I was quickly transported to an aromatic bazaar. Each bite is a medley of flavor, perfectly balancing the robust spices without overpowering the tender, well-ground meat. The addition of barberries adds an unexpected yet delightful tanginess, providing a sophisticated contrast that left me craving the next bite. It s so good that I forgot to take a picture! The Lamb Shank is nothing short of a revelation. Slow-cooked to perfection, the meat falls off the bone with just the touch of a fork, melting effortlessly in the mouth. The succulent lamb, enhanced by a subtle infusion of rosemary and garlic, creates a depth of flavor that is both comforting and luxurious. The Fesenjoon Duck Breast takes center stage as a dazzling fusion dish. The duck, cooked to perfect tenderness, harmonizes with the pomegranate and walnut sauce in a captivating symphony of flavors. The dish holds a delightful surprise with every bite - the sweetness of the pomegranate, the earthiness of the walnuts, and the rich umami of the duck meld into a velvety, complex, and utterly unforgettable experience. Lastly, the dessert of Walnut, Date, and Honey Baklava is a crowning glory. This is not your run-of-the-mill baklava; this is a confection worthy of poetry. The thin, flaky pastry layers, interspersed with the nutty crunch of walnuts and the sweet chewiness of dates, come alive under a drizzle of honey. This baklava strikes a brilliant balance of sweetness without being cloying, and each bite is an indulgent pleasure. In all, Delara provides an exquisite culinary journey that captivates and delights. Their thoughtful use of traditional ingredients, skillful cooking techniques, and innovative flavor combinations ensure a memorable dining experience. Whether you re a fan of Persian cuisine or new to its charms, Delara is a destination worth visiting.

Lunch at Delara is just delightful! We had the Braised Lamb Shoulder Sandwich and the Roasted Chicken Leg and Barberries. Both dishes were so tasty that we ended up sharing half and half just so that we can eat both dishes each! The pulled lamb in the sandwich was so tender. The sourdough flatbread was actually very light and fluffy so it s not heavy on the stomach at all. The herbal notes makes this sandwich very light and yet delicious! The roasted chicken was tender and fragrant with the Barberry sauce. The accompanying saffron rice is delicious with a crusty layer on top. The herbed salad was so refreshing with the dill and mints in it. Drinks and wine menu offers quite a lot of choices. The rhubarb hibiscus sharbat was a bit too sweet but tasty nonetheless. This is our second time here and would go again any time we ll be in the area.

Ive been to many Persian restaurants. Many. The one thing most of them have in common is their disbelief in customer service. Many Persian restaurants that Ive been to all over the world...it seems to be a pattern that as long as they seat you, they bring you what you ordered and when done take your payment....then theyve done their job. Its really interesting, its almost as if the staff just walk around like theve been up for 12 hours straight trying to feed a newborn that just wont eat or sleep, and they just want it to end. This is pretty much the theme with most Persian restaurants. With this place the pattern that Ive seen so many times repeat itself was broken. Ill tell you how. Typical Persian restaurants: 1. No service 2. Depressing Persian music 3. Dated and Dusty decor 4. Bad lighting (if any) Now as for our experience at DELARA. When we first walked in right away the atmosphere was bright, modern, clean and shiny with a great smell....at the same time we were greeted by a warm welcome...like someone would into their home as if expecting a personal guest, and which is so characteristic of the Persian culture. I was so surprised, expecting the opposite, that I thought for a second that we were in the wrong place. The seating area, menu and table arrangements were contemporary, beautifully decorated with a fresh and tasty food selection. A new and fresh spin on Persian food. I was excited! Our waitress was so bubbly, friendly and attentive that it made the experience wonderful. She smiled. Yes, smiled! ....trust me thats not something you see very much in Persian restaurants. The food was fresh, creative and innovative and one thing I noticed that I have never noticed before in any restaurant ....Persian or otherwise, was that their food tasted homemade. Have you ever eaten out and the food tasted homemade? Yeah, me neither, that was the first time. Next time well be back for dinner, cant wait! :)
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Mori N, you are too kind! I am so happy that the restaurant and whatever it represents resonated with you and you had a nice experience. The homey feel (both for the food and the vibe) has been very important to me and Im so glad it came across during your visit. Hope to see you back at Delara again soon.

reviews.review_text: Walking in thr place, the atmosphere is great. Food and drinks are excellent. In my years of checking out good food ,this is the BEST persian food. It is not your everyday kabab koobeedeh, this is chef prepared ,beautiful  plates and drinks were awsome.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks Hossein! Im so happy you enjoyed our food and atmosphere. Come back any time!

reviews.review_text: Decided on Delara for a dinner with my daughter and her friends! My first time here and it was awesome! Some of the best Persian food I have had authentic but presented in a more western style! Vegetarian/vegan options are a bit limited but available. The highlight for me was the  Chicken and Barberries  . Delicately flavoured with an amazing barberry/orange sauce. The others who had been here before told me the menu is tweaked fairly frequently   so when you do go back you get to try something different! To quote Delara -  Noosh e jaan May it be sweet for your soul! Would highly recommend this place   and will definitely go there again.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Aw thank you for the lovely feedback! Noosh e jan!!

reviews.review_text: Food is outstanding. Thoroughly enjoyed the mains, hearty & flavorful. The crispy saffron rice under the chicken leg & barberries was really tasty; it had a good crunch & was tart and savory in a really satisfying way. The highlight was the chocolate halva cake; one of the tastiest desserts Ive had in a long time. The balance of flavours, temperature and textures was spot on. Our cocktails were simple & effective. Service was friendly & helpful but a little scattered. The venue is light, summery, & airy.

Delara is known for its delicious and diverse offerings that combine savory and sweet flavors, textures, and aromas. Here are some reasons why Brunch at Delara is so delicious: Fresh ingredients: Delara emphasizes the use of fresh, high-quality ingredients, and their brunch dishes are no exception. Fresh herbs, vegetables, and fruits are commonly used in a range of dishes, from traditional Persian breakfast and salads to sandwiches and soups. Flavorful herbs and spices: Persian cuisine is known for its use of aromatic herbs and spices, such as sumac, parsley, and mint, which add depth and complexity to dishes. These herbs and spices are often used in Delara s menu with classic elements a distinctive and signature taste. Cultural heritage: Delara cuisine is steeped in tradition and culture, with many dishes passed down through generations. This cultural heritage adds to the allure of their brunch menu making it a unique and special culinary experience. Combine this with excellent service and you have all five of my stars!

Amazing customer service and delicious foods, I ordered koofteh, lamb sandwich, grilled saffron rice with chicken. All was well prepared and cooked in best condition. Only concern was the portion of meals. Portions was very small for me and to be honest, I left there satisfied but not full
It s an amazing place to eat, so far is one of my favorite places in Vancouver. It was my first time eating Persian food and I was impressed. Really good food and Negronis.

Service here is excellent. Taller Asian girl with glasses was so friendly and comfy to talk to, as well as eggsy. Felt like friends. The decor in there is excellent with it being wide open and feeling very spacious. Can see the chef prepping all the food with care and how meticulous they are. Very nice!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Calvin. Hope to see you again soon.

reviews.review_text: Incredible food, super nice place. Had an amazing spinach mushroom stew and a smoked lentil salad. Food

Amazing tasty unique dishes. The chicken barberry rice is a must try. We also ordered Gheimeh dish which also tasted unique and delicious. The drinks were not as good as the food. There is a different menu for each time of the day and some items are seasonal so best to check in their website.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks so much Arash!

reviews.review_text: Absolutely phenomenal! In Vancouver, unfortunately, we do not have modern generation of Persian dining. With all my respect to other Persian restaurants, they are old class styles that you eat there with your family. Younger generations (like 20-40) enjoy modern styles these days. Eating in Delara, I had a flash back to my last meal in Iran. Having Persian core with western or French presentation is what we organically see in Iran and here at Delara. The food quality was great. The orange cake was fantastic. It brought happiness tears to my eyes as it absolutely tasted like what my grandpa used to bake. The staff were super friendly. We had a short chat with the chef/owner and he was friendly, as well. The restaurant design was very nostalgic, too. We loved our visit and it would be the place I will visit with my non-Persian friends to introduce Persian cuisine. Although, I will introduce other Persian restaurants to them as other styles of Persian food.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Mina, thank you so much for such lovely words. Im very happy that what we do at Delara is resonating with you. Hope to see you again soon.

reviews.review_text: Finally I got to try this amazing place. My wife and I both enjoyed every bite. This place is a golden gem in Kits. Simple menu is only made from local fresh ingredients and produce. The chef s talent in creating traditional Persian dishes is extremely unique. We had the Aush with fresh made in house bread. The main dishes both came with crispy saffron rice ( yum). And we finished it with saffron ice cream. Definitely will return for more. Service was absolutely delightful and she helped us through the menu. we also were lucky to meet the chef himself. Pictures not doing justice.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Axel. Im very happy you enjoyed your experience. Hope to see you again soon.

reviews.review_text: Pretty interesting place, including the menu. The flavour combinations are not something I can say I have tried before from other cuisines.
Amazing flavour and wonderful service. Definitely recommend to try this restaurant

We came to your restaurant today and I wanted to say that you are amazing in the taste of the food and in the decoration of the food, the customer service and the food were wonderful   , the spinach dip was wonderful, the olive dip was excellent, I am proud of you as an Iranian, I hope you will be more successful day by day.

We enjoyed the Grilled Beef Ghalieh - Tamarind and Herb Stew. The spice and texture combinations are unique, authentic Persian. In our dish the flavours were highly orchestrated and varied  bringing excitement to the experience of enjoying the dish. The wine list is equally unique (suggest trying the Alderlea Clarinet). Definitely plan on making reservations. Ever since the restaurant received their second Michelin mention even weekdays can be full. Wonderful hosts

We had a pleasant time. The decoration is minimalist and pretty. Maybe if the lights were dimmed it would make the place a little cozier. Our waitress was kind and attentive and she recommended her favorite cocktail (hop plum spritzer). The food was tasty and generous.

I like the Persian style and design of the restaurant. The atmosphere is really warm and welcoming. The staff are absolutely professional and kind. We ordered the grills cauliflower and mushrooms, saffron, pistachio. I can say the mushrooms, saffron, and pistachio is one of the most strange and delicious that I have ever tasted. This is the taste that you must try before you die  the cauliflower was soft and tasty and the good point was that it wasn t oily at all (maybe steam cooked). I loved the rice with saffron Tah Digh     Thank you CHEFF!

Very unique. I grew up in Iran, and I am very particular about the taste of Persian food, drinks, and dessert. I make them myself. This place is no traditional persian food place, and it doesnt need to be one. We have many traditional Iranian restaurants in North America. Some are one of the best in the world. Delara looks at the traditional Persian food and creates something new. You eat the food and drink the drink, you taste a childhood memory but you also tate the time you live in. I talked to the manager, and they worked hard on the menu and some of the best modernized persian food Ive tasted. This place sat in my heart during my short trip to Vancouver.  Highly recommended. I am going back to this place when I visit Vancouver again. BTW, that is a picture of Toot at the end If you lived in Iran, youd appreciate this in house made sweet. I havent had this for more than 20 years.

Every dish was both beautiful and delicious. The flavors were thoughtful, comforting and vibrant. We truly felt the warmth and love for the food in the service and ambience of the restaurant. Great spot for date nights or family meals. We look forward to future visits.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi s. e. Im so happy to hear that you enjoyed your meal and the love that we put in our work came through. Thank you you for these kind words. Hope to see you again soon.

reviews.review_text: Wow, had an amazing dinner here. This restaurant is definitely worth checking out. The service is great and the food is delicious. The octopus is a must order and I personally liked the grilled short rib and eggplant over the BBQ chicken. The lunch menu is different from their dinner menu so worth going twice to get the full range of what they offer. Thank you Delara for a lovely evening.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Mehr. Im so happy you had a nice experience. Thank you for leaving us such a nice review.

reviews.review_text: Stunningly redesigned interior of a previously tired old space. Beautiful and inventive cocktails, very good and reasonably priced wine list. Food is outstanding - no misses amongst our selections and the standouts were definitely the lamb shank and the mushrooms, saffron and pistachios. The rice is perfection. Bit busy with families early on, recommend a later reservation if you dont want kids around. Service was very nice but a little slow. Otherwise fantastic. Vegetarian options: Several vegetarian options, but many meat dishes would not be able to be made vegetarian. Kid-friendliness: A few kid-friendly dishes on the menu, but the place was busy with young families when we arrived at 6pm Wheelchair accessibility: No steps inside, or to the washroom.

We got the Smoked Rice and Lentil bowl, Chicken leg with saffron rice, Baklava and Doogh to drink. All were excellent. The lentil bowl was very flavorful and the chicken leg was cooked perfectly. The Baklava is made with dates and walnuts instead of the normal pistachio. The Doogh drink was sour but good.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Sean!

reviews.review_text: No doubt one of the best places that elevated the Persian cuisine in the most elegant and delicious way. Everyone was shocked as they tried their first bites! Magical tastes, meats were cooked beautifully, I mean everything was top notch! We ordered their Gheymeh, chicken and Barberries and their Fesenjoon, and trust me, they tasted better than any traditional format of these dishes! I heard that their dishes were a bit over priced, but I totally disagree! For the portion and the quality that they offer, it is a perfectly fair price. Cherry on top, the staff here are super nice!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you so much Fatemeh for the lovely review. Hope to see you back here again soon.

reviews.review_text: Modern Persian dining that combines nostalgia with pleasant surprises. The cocktails, the food, the aesthetics, and the staff are all amazing. Don t miss out on their Jame Jam and Emerald cocktails and Aush. We can t wait to be back.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Hoda. Hope to see you again soon.

reviews.review_text: Had a good lunch at Delara where I enjoyed both the atmosphere and seating. The lunch menu is very limited with the Kookoo Sibzamini and the Chicken Kabob Sandwich the best of what we tried. The Marinated Smoked Olives were enjoyable and definitely very smokey. I wouldnt recommend the Beef Gheymeh as I found the lentils to overwhelm the beef making it unique but not as flavorful as the others. The Simorgh was an enjoyable cocktail although the circle ice cube fills a large portion of the glass. Overall a good lunch although perhaps dinner would present more variety if youre looking to try Delara.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Daniel for the lovely feedback!

reviews.review_text: Perfect food, service, and atmosphere. The waitress was so kind and the food was unique, beautiful, and delicious. You should try their cake. It was perfection. Food : 5/5

Delara did not disappoint. From the ambiance to the service to the food. It was such a beautiful experience. Probably the best octopus I ve ever had! Everything was perfect. Each dish was perfectly executed and absolutely delicious. Highly recommend this restaurant and will definitely be going back.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Tania. Thanks very much for this kind review. Glad to hear you enjoyed your meal. Hope to see you again soon.

reviews.review_text: The experience was a delight. The place has opened very recently and they are serving a limited number of main dishes. The nostalgia of familiar spices took me back to my childhood in Tehran, but keep in mind, this is NOT your conventional Persian/ Iranian cuisine. Be ready to experience something new, I d say you should trust the chef. We came there as group, so we get to experience multiple dishes. My favourite was the salmon. The location is superb, the ambiance is warm and inviting, the cocktails are creative and refreshing. Add it to your list of  must visit .
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Azadeh. Thank you for this nice review. Im very happy that you enjoyed your time at Delara.

reviews.review_text: I would give this place 6/5 if I could. Delara gives you an experience that no other Persian restaurants in Metro Vancouver can provide. Ive heard a lot of good things and I finally decided to give it a try with a group of friends. The atmosphere and ambience was lovely. The choice of music which I think is very important was spot on, with loads of nostalgic classy Persian music. Our server Farzin went above and beyond to make sure we are comfortable and helped us with making decisions on drinks and food. The cocktails sounded very tasty and we got to try some. The pomegranate Margarita was my fave. I would 100% recommend this place for special occasions since its a bit on the pricy side.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: What a lovely review! Thanks a lot for coming to Delara and hope to see you again soon.

reviews.review_text: The chef has put a delicious twist to some Persian dishes. You can tell each dish has been carefully crafted with care and creativity. The atmosphere is great and the chef/ business owner even stopped at our table and asked what we thought about the food. I would definitely recommend this restaurant for anyone who s looking to have quality food!

If you re looking for something different and delicious, give yourself a treat and go to Delara!  The atmosphere is inviting, bright and open, service is friendly and servers are knowledgeable, and the food is prepared with unique combinations of spices that give a rich yet delicate flavour to everything.  I ve been to Delara 3 different times and ordered completely different meals each time and they all were excellent. Go there. I ll definitely go again!

Tasty Persian food in a beautiful, modern and warm setting along with heartwarming hospitality of Bardia the owner chef and his team, this is a must try in town! I had the pleasure of having dinner here at their limited opening. Food tasted phenomenal, this is a modern take on Persian with fresh local ingredients and aromas that take you to new places instantly. You could see food is prepared with much care and love, everything is well thought of and curated to provide a memorable experience. Will be back to try their lunch and brunch and enjoy the rest of the menu with family and friends. Thanks Delara!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks Mahbod for the lovely review. Hope to see you again soon.

reviews.review_text: What a delightful surprise! We walked into this place by chance. The words to describe our lunch experience were simply fresh. A simply fresh restaurant design, well prepared and simply presented fresh food. A simple menu featuring a few things done well. Refreshing to find a place like this.  Would like to come back to try more menu items.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you so much! Glad you enjoyed the food.

reviews.review_text: I just ate the leftovers from the dinner I had last night at Delara and they are still delicious. We had the Cauliflower and the flatbread and dips to start. Both were outstanding and delicious. Both are a must try. For mains we had the beef and the Fesenjoon with duck breast. Duck and beef were perfectly cooked with beautifully spiced and flavoured sauces to accompany. For two people this was a lot of food so if you get a bunch of appies, you can definitely share one main. The sour cherry negroni and the Persian Godfather cocktails were both outstanding. I also tried the Cardamom Sharbat and the Doogh, both of which I had never tried before. They were certainly interesting and worth a try if you like to try new things, which I do. We didn t have room for dessert so we took the baklava home. It was good, but not as good as everything else. I would definitely love to try everything on their menu and go back for brunch. Service was great and decor and ambiance beautiful.

We loved having dinner at this delicious neighborhood spot! From the moment you step in the decor is beautiful and service is warm and inviting. We ordered the dips as a starter and couldn t get over all the complex flavors packed into them. We asked the chef about what the ingredients were and at the end of the meal he was kind enough to stop by and offer us a small take home box with extra dip and bread as a treat :) Definitely recommend this spot if you find yourself in Kitsilano!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you so much! Glad you enjoyed it and hope to see you back here again soon.

reviews.review_text: I was lucky to find out about Delara through a friend. I haven t had Iranian food like it in Vancouver before, and it really set the standard high. The personal tahdig with our main dishes were such an amazing touch and cooked to perfection. All the ingredients were extremely fresh, spiced, and satisfying. It was a really unique exploration of Iranian cuisine that had me leaving really pleased, and a big thank you to our server Farzin who made it an extra special night.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Soha. Thank you for the kind review and I hope to see you back at Delara soon.

reviews.review_text: I absolutely enjoyed the atmosphere, it is well decorated with mix of modern and traditional persian components. Food is very delicious, must try Fesenjoon stew, it is special dish off the menu. Give them a call ahead to make sure they have it that day. It is sour fesenjoon stew with duck meat. Koofteh (Meatballs) also very delicious served with house made side bread. $$$ Prices are relatively high, and we almost paid $60 for just 1 dish and 1 starter. The fun part of the bill, they bring you some sweet treats that are very delicious. Staff are nice. You can find free parking spaces on back street.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Mohammadreza. Thank you for the feedback. Im glad you enjoyed your time at Delara.

reviews.review_text: The flavours at Delara are very unique. The fusion flare of the Persian dishes were absolutely delicious. For example, the Fesenjoon with duck instead of a more common chicken was succulent and fell off the bone. Surprisingly, the marinated smoked olives were a stand-out, as well. Ive eaten a great variety of olives across Europe and in the middle-east and these had an original flavour that I have never experienced. The service could use a bit of polish. Our server missed clearing our empty cocktail glasses and appetizer plates on two passes by our table. Regardless, my wife and I were so impressed with the food that we plan on bringing friends for our next visit.

Decided to go for brunch while walking down West 4th and chose to eat at Delara since there isnt a load of Persian restaurants in Vancouver! We ordered the smoked rice and lentil bowl with the lamb sausage (an additional $5) and the braised lamb shoulder sandwich. The smoked rice and lentil bowl had a zesty salad with fresh herbs, tahini chili dressing, an egg, and nuts and seeds. I highly enjoyed this balanced meal and left me extremely satisfied! The braised lamb shoulder sandwich had really tender lamb and was really delicious. Not pictured was the spiced cardamom sharbat which was so refreshing and cold, especially helpful for a heatwave. For anyone thats in the area, Id definitely recommend you to check this place out!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Stephanie! Hope to see you here again soon.

reviews.review_text: Food delicious Fast and excellent service Very nice place Come back soon Recommended dishes Crispy Saffron Rice
All the foods we ordered were super delicious.

Absolutely extraordinary. My new favourite restaurant. Do not sleep on this one. Now featured in the Michelin Guide. The beef, duck, meatballs, cauliflower, turmeric cake, and chocolate halva cake are all masterpieces. Everything I ve tried on this menu has been divine. Also hands down the most tender lamb shank I ve ever had. Bravo to the team there. Gorgeous decor and sumptuous food.

Everything from their cocktails and appetizers to their main and desserts was great! All the flavour combinations were so smart they made my heart smile. I have to admit that I m in love with their Zereshk spritzer, and I was already thinking about going back there for lunch while I was having dinner. A big mercii to Delara s team for our wonderful experience.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you so much Parmida for the lovely review. Hope to see you again soon.

reviews.review_text: A-mazing persian cuisine! We ordered koofteh and roasted chicken leg for lunch. The best persian food that I have been offered in a restaurant out of Iran. Perfect service, outstanding attention to details in food presentation and interior design of the restaurant. Friendly staff. Turmeric and orange cake was tasty, nostalgic and prepared with fresh ingredients. If I should recommend only one place to dine in Vancouver, I would say here with no hesitation.

This is the best restaurant ever!! (Except for Taco Bell, but, I mean, come on, Taco Bell is king). I know someone named Delara, this place must be named after her. I always knew she was the teachers favorite, but I didnt know she was so famous that they would name a restaurant after her. Im kinda jealous of Delara that they named a restaurant after her (Dont tell her I said that). But Im still giving this place cinco (5) stars because its so good.
Everything was absolutely fantastic. Can not wait to go back to try more of their foods

Ive been here 3 times already and never disappointed. The service is very friendly and the food is amazing. The combination of flavors are great and the presentation is very nice. They also can accommodate gluten free dishes for you. Its not a gluten free facility but they are careful with the cross contamination if you are celiac like I am, so let them know. Price is very good, I would even say cheap for the average in Vancouver. Dietary restrictions: Gluten free options

A place to experience innovation and creativity in persian cuisine. Chicken breast with barberries was moist juicy and flavourful and the meat was mixed with freshly chopped herbs.  short rib Gheymeh: very tender meat sitting in a well balanced-spice lentil stew. All came with a crispy crusted saffron rice which it was a little dry to my taste. I would call this place a fusion persian cuisine. Music selection and interior design were also well matched and unique. Things to improve: adding a soup or Ash style appetizers for cold Vancouver nights, maybe adding a grilled option to the Mains...
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks Sep. I took your advise and we now have Aush on our lunch menu! Hope to see you back again soon.

reviews.review_text: Delara is a place to explore the creativity and innovation in food and drinks at the same time. Bardia made a professional team and vibe in Kitsilano neighborhood for those who looking for the new tastes with traditional roots.

Our visit to Delara was an unforgettable journey to the heart of Persian cuisine with a strong focus on local ingredients. Run by one of the most prominent young chefs in Vancouver, Delara is a fantastic place to enjoy the food, the atmosphere, and Persian hospitality.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Alexandr. Thank you so much for the kind words. Im so happy you had a good time and hope to see you back at Delara soon.

reviews.review_text: Absolutely amazing Persian food. Im not an expert, but I think its my favourite in all of Metro Vancouver. I came with some friends for lunch, and we shared flatbread with seasonal dips, smoked rice and lentil bowl with beef, and fesenjoon. Everything was delicious. The interior is beautiful too, a lovely way to enjoy a meal.
It was cool to see the chef serving the tables, so humble. The food was a creative fusion and something different.

Came here last night for a late Mother s Day dinner. This was the second time we came to Delara but first time for dinner. Everything we ate was perfection, the restaurant itself is modern while still keeping a lovely cultural touch. The first time we went was for brunch and I wish I wrote that review sooner because their brunch was also amazing. The service was fast and thoughtful. My picky Persian mom LOVED everything she ate. I ve noticed most of the reviews that are negative are from fellow Iranians, which makes me sad because it seems they are expecting it to be something it s not and it s unfair because truly, best Persian restaurant I ve been to in this city. It s been a long time coming for one of our restaurants to not just be kabobs. Kudos to the owner and we will be back!!!!

Had dinner here tonight with some friends. Such a fantastic experience. Delicious food using fresh local ingredients. We tried most of the menu items (dishes were easy to share) and everything was amazing. Highly recommended. Will definitely be back!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Rebecca. Im so happy you had a good time.

reviews.review_text: I was referred by one of my friends to never miss a chance of trying this menu , he literally said  your life expectancy will rise as you try their meal  and I was blown away by the quality of the food and their interesting dish .I enjoyed my time here as one the highest quality of restaurants here in vancouver. I ordered koofteh, kookoo, lamb sandwich , gheymeh, chicken leg , doogh ,yogourt and coctail . I recommend all of you guys to try this restaurant , you wont be dissapointed.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for the kind words Siavash!

reviews.review_text: Really good food! Had an amazing experience. Server was really friendly as well and gave us some recommendations on the food. Overall amazing.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks Camilo. Hope to see you again soon.

reviews.review_text: We arrived by accident at this restaurant and we loved it, they are also in the Michelin Guide of restaurants in Vancouver. If you have the chance to go don t miss it. Food

10 out of 5!! Delara is the definition of a perfect high end fine dining Persian fusion restaurant. We had a fantastic night with our family and had a great experience with Delara s professional team. It is a perfect place to spend your night with your date. This team rocks and I hundred percent recommend it.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Pouyan. Youre too kind! Thanks a lot and hope to see you back here soon.

reviews.review_text: I had an absolutely fantastic time at this restaurant. The lamb shank, duck fesanjoon, sabzi, koofteh, and saffron-rice tahdig were all impeccably prepared and left nothing to be desired. Although the tahdig could have been a touch crunchier, the flavors were still delightful. The baklava and ice cream for dessert were a perfect end to the meal, satisfyingly sweet and enjoyable. Additionally, the selection of alcoholic beverages was impressive and complemented the dishes perfectly. The overall experience was outstanding, with excellent food, a cozy ambiance, and attentive service. It is different than other traditional Persian restaurant. In a better way with a better experience. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a memorable dining adventure.

They are not officially opened yet so we only tried their takeout menu. Incredible! So thrilled a modern Persian restaurant concept is finally opening in Vancouver. The chicken sandwich was amazing. The smoked eggplant dip was creamy and delicious. It all paired so well with the refreshing sekanjebin drink. For dessert we tried the saffron cream croissant and it blew our socks off. Can t wait for the full dine-in menu!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks very much Tannaz. Glad you enjoyed our food and drinks. Hope to see you soon again.

reviews.review_text: Went for my mother in-laws birthday. Physically great, the decor was nice, everything was clean and we got a table at the front by the open windows. Service was friendly and attentive. Plus our server was very understanding of our toddlers needs. Food was amazing and whole menu was traditional flavors but many with a slight twist. Starters, mains and deserts A+.

Perhaps the only fusion Persion place in town but, in my opinion, the best Persian restaurant that I have tried in Vancouver. Everything from appetizers to desserts are made tastefully with so much love and care in every dish. Cocktails are amazingly done as well. The decoration and music create a great ambiance to enjoy your food and have a relax conversation.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks Arash. Im happy everything resonated with you. Hope to see you back again soon.

reviews.review_text: Great experience. The traditional delicious iranian dishes with a modern and unique recipes that reflects todays modern iranian culture.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks Mana! Glad you enjoyed it and hope to see you here again soon.

reviews.review_text: Very well designed restaurant, friendly and welcoming restaurant. Creative twist on Persian food. Well done    worth the price , worth to try Only wished the rice was better quality Rice, or maybe it s me that wasn t happy with the basmati rice! Food

Such a wonderful dining experience! Incredible food, with such surprising and delightful flavours. A beautiful room with uplifting and contemporary decor. The staff, so warm and welcoming.  The octopus was the starring dish, absolutely delicious. Cant wait to go back and try the brunch menu!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you for the kind words Tiffany. Im very glad you had a nice experience.

reviews.review_text: 10/10 Went there with group of foodie and very picky friends  and guess what?! Everyone loved their food!! Not even a single negative feedback! (We have already planned to re-visit at least once a month) Quality was GREAT, taste was AMAZING and service/servers were VERY FRIENDLY. Also their kitchen is open concept so you can see your plate is made with so much LOVE and PASSION! I am not exaggerating if I tell you this was the most satisfying Persian dining experience I ve had in Vancouver for the past 15 years!! I would like to congratulate their whole team for showcasing the food and culture in the best way possible! THANK YOU!
So delicious! We had the roasted cauliflower, koofteh, and chicken and barberries. Definitely a new favorite place.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Aw thanks Michelle. Hope to see you again soon.

reviews.review_text: Drinks excellent. Cauliflower and kufta were excellent. crispy Rice was very good. Duck sauce was nice but the duck lacked a little something. 4.5 stars.

Tremendous experience.   This restaurant actually provides original food and flavours.   The menu is well-designed, providing vegetarian, light, and hearty options good for lunch or dinner.  The staff and service are great, and everyone is proud of the food they offer.  Tara is a real star and makes everyone instantly welcome. I will make this a regular.

One of the best Persian restaurants in town! Ive tried so many Persian restaurants in Vancouver, from the traditional to the modern one, but so far Delara is one of the best. We tried the fesenjan & zereshk polo (chicken and barbarry). Both were amazing, the duck is not fishy and the fesenjan was perfect. The zereshk polo was also amazing, but I wish we had a little bit more of the zereshk orange sauce for the chicken to make the chicken not too dry & to neutralize the dill flavor. But overall, it was amazing! We also tried the zeytoon parvardeh (smoke olives with pomegranate sauce) and saffron ice cream as well. The pomegranate sauce for the olives is amazing (very recommended to try!) and the cardamom cookies for the saffron ice cream was also AMAZING  . Lastly, dont forget to try the toot (marzipan candy) when they bring the bill for you. I didnt know about the candy before, but now Im addicted to it! Thanks for the great food and service!
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Aw, thanks Nafisa! Im happy you enjoyed your meal at Delara.

reviews.review_text: Fantastic experience. Enjoyed delicious, vibrant plates in a sun soaked atrium. Staff are very friendly and attentive.
reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thanks Beth. Hope to see you guys back in Canada again soon!
